reviews: I had read the reviews and saw some people had a problem with the spin cycle and that their washer would just continue to rinse and spin over and over. So I made sure we did everything to avoid that and used the level on my iPhone. Well what do you know, we had that problem. Unlike people who let it run over and over, I just did the "spin only" cycle and shut the water off to the washer so it could not fill back up. My husband was not too happy we were having this problem, so he downloaded a "bubble level app" on his phone, and it showed that it was not level like we had initially thought. We had to raise the front up quite a bit and I have since done two more loads and PERFECT!One thing I really like about this, is just how easy it is to operate. I have used my moms and it will "automatically" fill according to weight, which I never know how accurate that can be, so I like that you can choose your load size.The only advice I have is for people to actually level it, or they will have problems, it takes less than a minute and will save you time and the pain of having a problem, and do NOT trust the level on the iPhone, it's not accurate enough.

review_titles: "Some issues at first, but not bad now..."
reviews: There is definitely a learning curve with this product, and many of the problems mentioned in reviews on other sites are a result of operator error, which I now know from my own experience...We had this washing machine delivered on 5/3/15 and ran our first load that night. We noticed that it took a fairly long time to finish, but apparently that is pretty typical of HE machines. I did another load the next day...but the cycle never stopped! It would spin to the point where it should be done and then fill back up with water over and over again; according to reviews on other sites, this is a very common complaint. After the fourth time it re-rinsed (over two hours later on the "Quick Wash"), I powered the machine off in frustration and just threw everything in the dryer. I had not been using the HE detergent, so I thought maybe that was the cause of the problem. Tried the correct detergent the next day, but had the same issue. After SIX TIMES of the washer refilling, I shut it off again and decided to call it quits. Even when I would manually put it on the Spin cycle only, it would still fill with water. I went to Lowe's yesterday and told them I wanted to swap it out for something else, but the sales associate gave me some pointers and suggested giving it one more chance.Thanks to my conversation with the salesman and a fair amount of Internet research on the quirks of HE washers, I was able to figure out how to make this machine work correctly. First of all, HE detergent is a must (even though this particular washer only "recommends" it). Next, even though these HE machines do not have an agitator, you still have to treat them as if they do--position your laundry in a circle leaving a space in the center. I made the mistake of just dumping everything in there, but that will cause problems with the rinsing and spinning. Lesson learned. I also read that you should put heavier items on the bottom and lighter items on the top, but I did not do this and everything worked fine. Just something to keep in mind. Finally, make sure that it is properly balanced. If the drum is even slightly off, it messes with the sensors or something and the washer gets all confused (not to mention noisy). I used a bubble level to get mine just right. After doing these things, I was finally able to wash a load of clothes with zero issues. The Quick Wash took just over 35 minutes, which is good/average for an HE. When it started playing the song at the end of the cycle, I literally jumped for joy.All that being said, when the washer fuctions correctly, it seems to be a pretty good machine for the money. The clothes come out clean and fresh-smelling, and there is a ton of space in the drum, even after leaving an open circle in the middle. I love all the different options for water level and temp, and it's easy to use. I guess I need a little more time and experience to make a fair judgment, but so far so good.

Stay away from SamsungPurchased a WA40J30000 series washer on 6/4/15. Washer didn't work from day one. I now entered the Samsung merry-go-round. I was told that under no circumstances would Samsung replace the washer or refund my money until their "process" was complete. That process involved 7 service calls and the replacement of every electronic component except the motor. The repairman finally gave up. On August 10, 2015 I received a refund check. 10 weeks without a washing machine.My issue is not that the machine didn't work. The issue is how Samsung handles the problem. This problem was identical to a service issue I had with a Samsung TV. The Samsung "process" insures the consumer will be inconvenienced as much as possible. Having spent 10 weeks without a washer and after spending hours on the phone and rearranging my schedule to have 7 service calls I can safely suggest it would be easier to wash your clothes over a rock on the river than buy a Samsung product.

I have read reviews on this good and bad. I was a little afraid after purchasing that I would not be pleased. However, we set it up as instructed making sure it was level. Lowe's would have set it up for us and the delivery men were great, but we were not ready to install when they came. It works perfectly and is quite low noise. It does take a long time to spin out but the clothes come out much dryer after the spin than they did with my old washer. I prefer this to having to dry them a longer time. Much more energy efficient that way. I have completed 6 loads of wash so far and have only had it for 3 days but so far so good.

Machine #1 delivered, they made sure floor and machine was level, then made sure it ran and water was working and left. I proceeded to put a Quick Wash load in and went off to watch TV. I came back 1.5 hours later and it was just hitting the final spin. I left and came back to find it refilling with water so I waited there reading a magazine till it finished. When it was done I waited for the door to unlock but instead of unlocking it started to refill again at which point I hit pause and when it unlocked I took out the clothes and put in the dryer. Thus my nightmare began. No matter what cycle I used it always got hung in the final rinse, spin and I had to stand around and wait to manually stop it and remove clothes.I once put a quick load in and went to town and arrived back home 4 hours later to find it still running in the rinse spin cycle. SO SO UNHAPPY. I called Samsung because I know there is a learning curve with the new impeller top loaders. I was not impressed with their help because she was reading from a scripted message. She said it was a leveling issue and I told her it was not. The guys leveled the machine and I loaded all the loads the way the book said and used the recommended cycles but still the same thing. SO......I called Lowes and they cheerfully came and removed that machine and replaced it with a new one. (Same machine) Long story short it was the same issue. So I went to the store in person and talked to the appliance manager and the store manage and in the end I purchased a Samsung front loader and they came yesterday and picked up the #2 machine and installed the #3 front loader. I stayed with Samsung so it would at least half way match the new dryer we bought that matched the #1 washer. My husband wanted to NOT get another Samsung washer but I wanted to give them a chance. The new front loader works like a champ. I will review it in its place. I also found out that the day I returned #1 another customer returned that exact same machine with the exact same problem! So....... My final opinion on this machine is there is a defect somewhere and I would NEVER recommend it. However, I would also say don't judge Samsung on 1 machine.Koodos to Lowes for superior customer service because it took a numbers of calls and visits to finally get me a machine that I was happy with and never once did they make me feel like it was my fault!

When our previous washer (Maytag) died after only 6 yrs, We purchased the Samsung and have not had any of the issues that 'some' previous reviewers have posted. The first day I had to go into the laundry room to make sure it was still running because it was so quiet.

The top loader was delivered and installed on Friday. We were out on Saturday and returned home after 9:00 PM; when we started our first load of wash (small delicates) we expected it to be done in less than 90 minutes. When two hours had passed, we noticed that the rinse cycle was constantly filling, spinning, draining, restarting over and over again. We finally shut it off manually and wrung out the clothes. When we call our local store, they reported that at least 4 of this model had been returned with same problem during the past week. They suggested we look at a different model which we plan to.

This washer has a deep well, no center agitator which allows for more clothes, very quiet and most of all, it offers small, medium, large water supply of your choice. Most of the new machines don't offer this feature. The salesperson at Lowes was very kind to help me purchase this even though he was on his way to lunch. Wish I had his name but he went above and beyond his duties and cared enough to help me out. Great experience shopping at Lowes in Abingdon, Maryland.

My wife loves that it does not have the agitator and has lots of room for the clothes. It washes the clothes well and is a lot quieter than our old Whirlpool. I was going to buy another Whirlpool but the reviews was bad on the ones I was looking at and the Samsung was better. My Whirlpool lasted eight years I will have to see how long this one lasts it seems to have a better warranty, but time will tell.

My husband bought me this washer and the matching dryer. I love it and haven't had any of the problems that others have mentioned in their reviews. We did make sure that the washer was totally leveled. I really like the soft tune it plays when it is done. It sure beats a loud annoying buzzer. The only thing I wish I could do that you can't with this machine is change load size once it has started. Other than that it works great and no more bras tangled around the agitator!

So you've probably seen some of the negative reviews on this unit, and I almost thought I was going to be in that boat, however not the case.  Lowe's came over and delivered my washer and dryer combo, set everything up, and left.  The first load of laundry did what others on here said.  Kept repeating the rinse cycle and wouldn't stop.  I was almost ready to take it back when I checked to see if the washer was level.  It was definitely out of level.  I went ahead and leveled it up, and checked the dryer, it wasn't level either so I took care of that.  Threw in another load of clothes and sure enough, it started working great, and has been ever since!  The normal wash cycle takes about 90 minutes for a large load.  Which seemed like a long time to me coming from a standard washer, but the clothes are just damp when they come out, and the dryer gets them dry in about 15-20 minutes.  So not too bad!  Washes clothes great, quiet, and even sings to you when the wash is over!  Glad I purchased it.
Large tub, very quiet operation, sings to you upon each selection. Faster washing than our previous washer.

Bought this to replace my old washer with the agitator. I absolutely love this washer. Its big enough for a King sized comforter. It wrings the clothes out really nicely. I can do more in one load so that saves me time. I wasnt sure at first because I'd heard they take longer to wash. The cycle does last a little longer but I find its not a problem. There is a quick wash setting too which is pretty fast. I researched before buying about all the different washers. I was really afraid of the new ones without the agitators after reading reviews. I talked to a clerk at the store and he assured me if I didnt like it for any reason I could return it within 30 days. I loved it so much I went and bought the matching dryer within a couple of weeks! All of the bad reviews I dont understand. I've not had one issue yet and I've had it for about 2 months. I have no issues stopping the washer to add something if I've forgotten. It uses plenty of water and the clothes get fully wet and are cleaned well. Its so quiet when washing you dont even know its on. I am so happy with my purchase of this washer and the matching dryer!!! I cant say enough good about it ! I love love love this washer! I cant speak to the longevity of the product as I've only had it a couple of months. Bought the extended 3 yr warranty! Hope not to have to use it but just incase. Buy it ! I think you will love it!

We sadly had to replace our 18 year old Whirlpool top loading washer after the rinsing cycle started to malfunction. Choosing to price washers vs. research repairing the old machine, we chose to try a new model. Reading comparison reviews and speaking with a knowledgable salesman at Lowe's we found this model at a good price and took advantage of the sale and warrantee choices. This model has just enough 'bells & whistles' to meet our needs. The purchase/delivery/installation went smoothly and within 2 days we were washing clothes & sheets within a half hour after the delivery. The absence of the agitator doesn't change how we load our clothes; we never packed our previous washer too tight and are familiar with redistributing a load to prevent unbalanced cycling. We have tried all settings several times and have had no problems. There are no really strange sounds when you compare it to our older washer's agitator's sounds. The extra bonus of the Samsung is a quiet process of stages with a bell song at the end to tell us the load is finished!

I had the same never-ending rinse/spin cycle problems with this washer that others here have described. I tried all of the fixes others listed here, including making sure to use HE detergent, loading clothes as if it had an agitator, heavy items on the bottom, leveling, power cycling, making sure the drain pipe wasn't clogged, etc. These things helped because my washer at least started working properly for certain loads but the problem still occurred about every 3rd wash load so I finally called Lowe's extended warranty service number. The tech came out the same day and suspected he knew what the problem was. Before he did anything, he checked my serial number and confirmed that the program control board needed to be replaced. According to him, the wrong PCB was installed in my washer and my serial number was in the range of the washers that had this issue. I do like this washer now that it works properly and kudos to Lowe's and their repair service. I don't expect every product to work properly so it is nice that they back up what they sell. I hear others have had problems getting warranty service from Samsung, which is unfortunate. It makes me glad I decided to go with the extended warranty and deal directly with Lowe's. From the guy I spoke to on the phone, who did a good job of confirming that I had tried the fixes before dispatching someone, to the tech who showed up way sooner than I would have expected, I had a great experience dealing with Lowe's extended warranty service.

I purchased this washer when buying our new house, and the spin cycle would run continuously. Because of this, the water usage skyrocketed because it would spin dry, then refill with water, and the electricity usage was higher than normal. Loads would take 6+ hours before I would shut the water supply off and spin it again. This happened for several weeks before the technician could come out. The technician fixed the problem within minutes and said that this was a known issue on all units produced within a 5 month window. These units were somehow not recalled, even though it was a known issue. My water bill spiked to $650 and $450 the two months that this was an issue (it was fixed part way through the second month) and Samsung has been less than useless at helping resolve the issue. I'll never buy another Samsung product after the miserable experience dealing with their “customer service” department.

I read the reviews here prior to purchasing this washer (and the dryer). I was a little concerned with the reviews about it continuously cycling, but it seemed like most people were able to correct the issues with learning how to use the machine. Since the set fit so nicely into our budget, and we have had great previous experiences with Samsung, we decided to give it a go.Delivery was quick and easy, and I have done easily 15 loads. As suggested by other reviewers, I placed the clothes within the dryer as if there was an agitator. I had absolutely no issues with it restarting, and it has been working perfectly. I like that there aren't too many options (if you like bells and whistles, it might be too basic), and it handles clothes, towels, and blankets with ease.

We have this washer for 2 weeks now and so far so good. It is very quiet as it runs and easy to use. It has a lot of room and I just washed a comforter in it. I was worried that it would be too heavy for the washer and cause the washer to be out of balance and prevent it from finishing the cycle. To my pleasant surprise, there was no problem. This washer spins the clothes to almost dry. We had a front loader previously, which is supposed to spin the clothes to near dry, but this washer does a much better job at that. It is very deep, but I really don't mind that at all; however, someone fairly short may have difficulty reaching the bottom of the washer. I don't use the dispenser for the detergent though; .I don't see the point, as the detergent immediately runs down to the clothes. Maybe I'm missing something there? Overall, I am very happy with its performance so far.

I don't know if Lowes/Samsung is going to be discontinuing this model or not, but right now it's the best deal at Lowes for a top loader. My wife wanted it instead of a front loader, because she likes to take things in and out mid-cycle and she worried about that part with a front loader. Our previous washer/dryer lasted 16 years; we expect to maybe get 10 out of this combination. There's a lot of electronics on these devices nowadays and I think that could be more that can go wrong that you can't fix yourself. I guess we'll wait and see on that. Set yourself up with a warranty extension if you're concerned about that.I moved it around, didn't level it, didn't read the directions, just pushed the buttons and did a load. Worked fine! No issues! These washers are quieter, that's for sure. The agitator at the very bottom is electronic - that's struck me strange at first as it cycles on and off electronically. The (gas) dryer is on back-order, so we don't have it yet, but if it doesn't come in they'll need to come and take this out of here, because we bought the matched set. All total it was $1009.00 and you can easily spend 50% more on a washer/dryer combo, all you need to do is go and look. We bought this set because it was the best price and we're heading for retirement so we need to be a little mindful on how much we spend.Seems good, works great so far. One thing I did notice, and this isn't really a problem, is that when you select a large load and after it fills up and starts, you don't seem to be able to switch to an extra large load to put more water in it. It wants to keep to the original selection. Again, not a problem, you just need to know your loads when you first start.Lastly, great sales help at Lowes! She hopped on the phone, called the warehouse, found out when the shipment of gas dryers were coming in, reserved one for us... took care of business :)

I liked the design with the extra large tub. My washer was balanced. I followed all the instructions in the Samsung booklet and advice given by the salesman to operate this high tech washer. The washer would not cut off. I started a load at 3:30pm and it was still running at 6pm! It kept repeating the wash/rinse and spin cycle. I spent a lot of time checking to see why my loads hadn't stopped yet. I had 4 loads that stopped correctly after 1 1/2 hours. After 1 week of trying over and over again, I returned the washer to the store to get a regular washer one that is fast, efficient, and one with the wringer in the tub. Also, the detergent cup does not hold the liquid in place until you slide the door close, it just runs out onto your laundry. If you are a busy person and like to utilize your time wisely, this is not the washer for you.

I received my new Samsung washer WA40J3000AW. It is a model without the center agitator. I was so excited to be the proud owner of yet another Samsung product. When the washer was delivered it was checked to see if it moved side to side, I guess this was the way to see if it was level. I started my first load of laundry and the spin cycle kept running and the machine finally reached the high "rev" and the just moved back and forth and vibrated a lot. This seems to be a problem with the machine per research on the Samsung website , as it has to be 100% level on all FOUR SIDES!! Please insist when the machine is installed that a level is placed one at a time on all four sides, verifying that the machine is level. I didn't know about this and took the installers word that it was level. When I called Lowes I was informed by my salesman # who by the way was totally Awesome!! Thanks Nic# that the person in charge of delivery/install told him to tell me that the machine was level when it was installed. But, I learned it wasn't because even though it would not physical rock back and forth when attempting to move it, the placing of the level on each of the four side proved it was not level. I was informed that they could send someone out to level it but it would have to be 6 days away, and that they could send another machine out but doing that would be a week or more out. I am so upset and frustrated. Not usually a thing that happens with Lowes customer service. Just remember INSIST that a level is used when the installer levels your agitator less Samsung washer. Still waiting for someone to level it correctly or have anew one installed...

I have owned less than 4 years.  I had a repairman out for the 3rd repair in this time period.  Instead of paying the $425 repair charge, I am cutting my losses and getting a new washer.  Samsung's customer service was pathetic.

This is the best washer we've ever had. There is no agitator sticking up out of the middle; our last washer trapped clothing under the agitator and cost us over $100 to have it fixed. The newer technology of agitating the laundry in the drum does an excellent job of cleaning. The spin cycle is so much more efficient that the laundry takes less time for my dryer to dry them. Very happy we bought this model. Easy to use and works great.

review_titles: "Read the book and you'll be happy!"
reviews: One of my favorite reviews of the HE washers basically said over and over "Read the book".. Seriously. That's all you need to do. This is one of the more simple washers to operate, and the book makes it easy. Don't throw your clothes in it - just circle them around the center and set it correctly, and it works great! This is fairly quiet, but it makes a few different sounds from a traditional washer - but it isn't the same so I'd expect it to be different. This model also "sings" at the end of a cycle. My only thing that I don't like is that the lid locks once you push start - but I get that is a safety feature - I mean the drum is HUGE on this. Great purchase for the price.

review_titles: "Walk away, if u want to keep it for awhile!"
reviews: We bought this 2 years ago.  Nothing but problems. We have had it fixed numerous times until our warranty ran out and now they no longer make the parts so we now have to go buy another washer. A few things that have gone bad. The pump. It gets clogged a lot, just from small things so then it wont drain. Also, getting off balanced =, we have had it replaced numerous times. I wasn't even doing heavy loads and when I have had people come out to look at it they have said this has happened all the time to people. Also, its a pain to figure out manually to bypass and have it drain if there is an issue. So, I would not recommend this washer. We are very dissapointed but we didnt do a lot of research on it before, so thats our fault. We just had to buy a new one and its coming this week. We decided to go with a front loader Maytag, better manufacturing warranties and its had good reviews.

I am giving this washer 3 stars, but yesterday I would have given it 5. I was very skeptical going in as the reviews are very mixed for this washer, but it had all the features I wanted and didn't have all the extras I didn't need so I went for it. I was in love for a whole 4 days. I honestly love the way it washes, it gets the clothes very clean! It will fill with water to whatever level you preset so I really liked that it didn't skim on the water. You can pause the wash also to add in a garment if forgotten, or if like me, to be curious and see if it is actually filling up:). It has an extra large tub and while I had it I was able to wash my king size comforter without any issues, it actually looked like a full size comforter in the large tube:) Like I said for 4 days I thought I finally had the washer for my family of 7 that would last us for a long time......5 year warranty and all! Unfortunately, it has already malfunctioned in only 4 days:( When I went in to check a load I had put in, the entire board was lit up and the Medium LED was flashing. I got the manual and it states to call for service(really?) as the water level sensor is defective. I don't want to confuse anyone it does not sense how much water to use but for instance if I pushed for a medium load it would just keep filling up with water to the brim of the tub because the sensor that says it's at a medium or whatever selected water level is defective. As stated earlier, if this review had been written just one day sooner it would have been 5 stars, excellent etc etc.....I am giving it 3 stars b/c honestly I am so disappointed, but I loved the washer, I have 5 children and 2 have special needs so I have some heavily soiled laundry sometimes but this washer had no problem taking care of it. Everything came out exceptionally clean. For me, the reason I did not opt to exchange the washer is b/c of the previous statement, I have a lot of special needs for a washer and I just cannot be on hold for a repair man if it malfunctions and being it already has I am not confident that the next one will hold up either so I am choosing to go back to the older agitator models without all the digital features. If you get a good one, you will love it if this is what you are looking for, this is the only washer that lets you choose the water level without the agitator so I was so excited, but hey at least I got a good 4 days of washing done!

I have had this machine for one day.  It takes over an hour to wash one load, constantly beeps and has to be restarted.  I started doing laundry at 3 pm and it is now 11:30 pm...Between the beeps and the restarts and resets I have completed only one load of laundry.  This is a terrible machine, I can't believe that Samsung would let this go to market

I am glad that I did not submit an earlier review with favorable things to say. I have had this machine since the beginning of June and had problems with it the other day. Called for service and they came out today. He brought a new memory board with him which alerted me right away that there have been issues with this model before. He installed the new board and was still making noise. The reason is that I need a new motor already!!! Three months and I need a new motor. I could not believe it. He is coming back out on Friday to fix. Called Samsung and ended up being disconnected. I was calling because I felt I deserved a new machine instead of a fix. She told me before we were disconnected that I would have to have three service calls before they would replace. I just happen to be off today and Friday so I do not have to take any additional time off from work. Maybe what happened to me was just a fluke and I won't have any additional problems with it for many years but I think buyers should be aware. I do have to commend the service repair company which came out promptly and tried very hard to correct the issue.

Replaced my 18 yr old Maytag washer and didn't think I'd find as good a washer as that one. But this Samsung is top quality. Have only used twice since it arrived but I'm very pleased. It is quiet, quick and the little jingle at the end is a pleasant up-grade from the old buzzer. I'd purchased the matching dryer about one month earlier and I am also very pleased with it. Keep up the good work, Samsung.

Have run about 8 loads of laundry thru this machine so far and have not had any issues. We made sure we followed all directions while installing the machine including making sure it was level and running a test cycle. Love the size of the drum as it fit & washed a comforter with no problems. My only issue is reaching to the bottom of the drum for that last lonely sock since I am only 5'4", but a step stool solves this problem if needed. This machine is much quieter and does not shake/vibrate like my front load washer did. Hopefully it lasts for many years.

Knowing that we were going to cloth diaper our first child I saw this on sale at Lowes while shopping for something else, after standing in store and doing a little research it looked like a great washer. I of course price matched, and used a military discount. I got the washer & matching dryer for the price of one! I saw quite a few reviews about it leaking water and coming home to a mess. We bought the pan for the bottom just in case, and didn't run the washer unless we were home for the first few months, but we've had no problems so I'm very comfortable starting a load of laundry and leaving. It has lots of cycle options, which is great for cloth diapers. I just change the cycle to heavy, push the presoak button and extra rinse. it's a 2 hour cycle and works great for the diapers.The only CON i have is that it holds water in the spot where you put detergent. it should be at an angle more so that all of the water comes out. if you don't do laundry for awhile I could see the water there starting to mold. Lucky for us that isn't an issue. I normally open the "soap drawer" all the way and stick my hand back there and push all the water out that I can just so it isn't sitting there.

So we have been victims of Samsung now for months. First our dryer quit working after six months. It took them months to get it fixed. At first they said they were going to replace it, then changed their minds. Then we get a notice that our washer might explode. So we lost a bunch of money on that deal because they prorated the worth of the machine. Our year old machine was worth $300 less. We had to eat that cost. I had no intention of buying a new washer! Now my four month old Samsung replacement washer has a broken piece on the lid. Samsung won't replace the piece. They say it's not under warranty. They want $400 to replace the entire lid. Are you kidding me? Their business model is awful, and their customer service is worse. Buyer beware!

review_titles: "Worst piece of Junk I ever bought!"
reviews: I tried washing a light weight blanket. It won't wring it out. It starts too, then stops, refills with water and tries again, and fails again, and again, and again. Then all of the light start blinking and it starts beeping, so I turn it off and redistribute the weight and put it on spin. It refilled with water 4 times. I redistributed it again and again it filled with water 5 more times! After 6 HOURS it finally wrung it out. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND ***DO NOT BUY IT!****

Love it! Works really good, my clothes come out nice and clean and soft. This is the first brand new washer and dryer set I've ever bought and I really like it.I was on the fence after reading other negative reviews but I'm glad I bought it anyways.Good looking units, little taller than traditional machines. Runs quiet and doesn't seem to run much longer than traditional machines as some have complained. I also didn't feel they are obnoxiously loud, maybe a bit more than traditional units. I honestly think the majority of complaints are from people switching from 30 year old machines. You can't just cram whatever into it and expect the best results, I know as I've tried both ways!! Works it's best when you sort and select load type and size. I followed the manual and suggestions booklet and haven't had any problems! And on the fun side of this machine it plays a neat little jingle when the load is done vrs the old buzzer.I only have one complaint, the lid is plastic (and that's fine) and scratches extremely easy!! First time I set a laundry basket on the lid it made it look ugly :( I do miss the porcelain finish from the old machines!  Overall just like all my other Samsung products this one proved awsome!!

I've never in all my years had a washing machine malfunction in less than 2 weeks of buying it. We have always had Whirlpool appliances but thought we'd give Samsung a try. This product is very noisy and sounded like it was on it's last leg from the first load.  We understood, however, that we just needed to get used to a new washer with new sounds.  Then last night, in the middle of a load, all the lights on the unit lit up, it wouldn't spin out, and water seemed to be backing up into the hose and tray where detergent is placed.  This was a normal medium sized load. There was no explainable reason for these issues.  Then I looked at reviews of this produce online (something we certainly should've done before ever purchasing this unit) and saw that others had experienced the very same issues with numerous people giving this product a "1" rating.  That too is what I am giving this product. I've never had an experience like this. Lowe's is coming to pick it up tomorrow and I'm getting a full refund.

This washer is great. I guess they have worked out all the bugs with it. I've had no issues like some have posted here. It takes about 1 hr to do a normal load of laundry. I would guess a large or extra large load would take an hr and a half at the most. I've had no issues with repeating spin or rinse cycles like some have said. The lowe's crew set it up and leveled it and it works perfectly :)Use high efficiency detergent that is recommended. These types of washers don't use normal detergent that makes a lot of suds. Less suds means the clothes move around more during the wash cycle and get cleaned better. (I was told if you do use regular detergent use half as much as you normally would)When you load the clothes try to balance it out. It doesn't matter if washing a lot of socks and underwear or something but when washing 4 pairs of jeans even it out. Don't put all the jeans on one side and all the light stuff on the other so to speak. Really this is something that should be done no matter what washer you use. It's just common sense. Balance out the load as much as possible. It really only matters with heavier items like jeans, towels, sweatshirts, etc.You can put stuff in the middle but it will be on the outside when the cycle is done washing. it spins everything to the outside so you might as well leave a small hole in the middle when loading the clothes anyways. If you do put something in the middle make it small stuff like socks and lighter items. I guess you could just dump the basket of clothes in and go for it. I haven't really tried it but I don't think it is an issue unless you get all heavy items on one side and all light items on the other which makes it get out of balance. As long as it's reasonably balanced you shouldn't have any issues.During the wash cycle it runs a bit then cuts off. It does this over and over in short bursts. It is different from the older machines that just run constantly during the wash cycle. I guess this is due to not having an agitator in the middle or some sort of energy saving thing. It does work though so no issues cleaning the clothes :D

This Washer from Samsung is bad.. • You cannot select the water temperature. Of course, you can select, according to the manual whatever you want, but the machine “picks” the temperature for you. Example: The selection - normal cycle (for soiled cloths which I would like to wash hot), hot water, medium load (which you can pick according to the manual) - actually fills with cold water. • Samsung customer service and Lowe's appliance sales staff is not aware that if you select “hot” the machine uses “cold” and will schedule a “service person” to come to your house to check it out (or swap the machine if it is less than 30 days old).• You cannot change the washing cycle. You cannot add cloth and change from small to large, from cold to hot load. Once the cycle started it will finish no matter what. • Extra Large, Heavy Duty has never been able to balance itself. The procedure to get this corrected is: 1. Wait forever (because the lid is locked while the machine is in motion) till the lock on the lid releases so you can re-distribute the load manually. 2. Re-distribute the load. 3 Turn the machine back on and wait and see if it worked. 4 Most likely you have to repeat the process 2-3 times because you can't see where the heavy side/low side is when you can finally open the lid. About a 10 minute processes. Samsung, I want a washing machine where I can decide the water temperature, open the lid when I want to add/remove cloth, change temperature or cycle. I want to decide when and where to save energy. Washing machines are for adults and trying to make it “toddler safe” with a locking lid (not talking about the child lock) and “energy efficient” by forcing me to use cold water for, as you list in your manual, heavily soiled cloth is stupid beyond stupid.

First there is a design flaw when it comes to balancing the machine. Only the front feet are adjustable. That means you can only balance the machine front to back, not side to side. If you live in an older home and there is the slightest tilt in the floor there is no way to balance it. Next comes the rinse & spin cycle loop. If the sensors detect an out of balance load. which happens just about EVERY wash cycle, the machine will fill, drain and attempt to spin again. This results in a loop that can last for hours if you do not catch it. We have had this washer 4 months and our water consumption has gone up dramatically compared to when we had an older non-efficient washing machine. Samsung is of NO help on this issue. I would have been better off spending the money to repair my 15 year old machine over purchasing this one. If you like wasting time, money and water this is your machine.

reviews: I bought this washer just over 6 months ago with the dryer that is its pair. Here are all the reasons I would rather hand wash my clothes than use this.1. It basically gets them wet and tangled and nothing else.3. It tangles EVERYTHING I put in it. It does not matter what quantity. If you want to spent a good 10 minutes de-tangling all your clothes then this is the washer for you. If you want all of your clothes to be stretched out and excessively wrinkled than this is a great washer for that. You didn't know two towels could be tangled? Oh they can. If you put it in there, it will be in knots when you get it out.The only thing more awesome than this washer, is the dryer it goes with. You will spend 10 to 15 minutes trying to turn it on. Its awesome if you hate your life and want to stand in your laundry room all day.

The machine will not conduct a completely balanced spin even when empty. (And yes, it is properly installed and leveled; it was installed professionally by Lowe's.) The machine will attempt to re-balance the load by automatically adding water during the spin cycle, but because of the design flaw it never finishes the cycle; it remains "stuck" in the spin cycle in what amounts to an endless do-loop trying to re-balance, then spin, re-balance, then spin, etc. I've had the machine for two weeks at this point, and only one load of wash has actually finished a complete cycle, and that took over 3 hours. Thus far, to complete most laundry loads I have had to manually interrupt the spin cycle, usually after it has done several iterations at re-balancing, by shutting off the machine after it spins but before it can add water to re-balance. As you might imagine, this is quite time consuming and extremely frustrating.

review_titles: "It's all about how you level it"
reviews: What everyone here is saying is true. I hooked it up, ran an empty test wash on rinse and spin and it seemed level and fine. Added a load of jeans and about 10 min later, it lit up like a Christmas tree with the large light flashing. Book says water level couldn't reach the proper level.So I decided to re-read the manual further and used the instructions on how to correctly level the machine. With an empty machine, start it on rinse and spin and let the bottom fill up for 3-4 minutes. You want just the center circle exposed. If you fill it too much, use a pitcher to empty it a little. This showed me the front legs were in deed too low. 7-8 turns of the front legs later and everything looked even with the water level centered all the way around the center cone at the bottom of the washer.Reloaded the jeans and it ran the load like a champ. As others have recommended, after tossing in a load, I dig down the center and expose the bottom just a little. Helps you balance the load better too. On load number 5 in a row. We purchased our Samsung maybe 6 months ago and from day 1 I was having problems. I read the book forward and backwards. First load I washed it like to have rocked off the concrete pad in our basement. Okay so maybe it isn't level as we thought it was. Fixed that, check. It was all level, clothes not just dumped in, laid accordingly. I wanted to be excited about being able to wash without the agitator being in the way and being able to put comforters in to wash. Second load of clothes did better. Third load ran forever, I thought I know it has been over 2 hours, why is it not done yet? All the lights flashing, signals dinging like crazy, clothes either are not wet at all or soak and stuck on the rinse cycle playing peat, peat, and repeat. So you are forced to manually put in rinse mode, then it doesn't spin out, it just keeps refilling, then you put it on spin and it runs forever. A load of clothes doesn't take 3-4 hours to wash I kept complaining. Absolutely ridiculous. My husband thought I was making it up. Maybe you're doing it wrong. Yeah, like I don't know how to use a washing machine like I have been the last 35 years. So you are the expert, you make it work right. Until he finally tried to wash a load (which he never has in his life) and it did the same to him. Then low and behold we receive a recall in the mail for our model less than 6 months after buying it. Problem is they aren't even giving us half the amount it cost to buy a new one with an exchange rebate if we stick with a Samsung product. Even though the paperwork clearly states you will get an "additional" loyalty incentive of up to $150 if you choose to stick with a Samsung. So I am thinking okay, they are offering to give me a rebate of $372 for my old one plus up to $150 extra as a loyalty incentive to buy a new Samsung to replace this one, and maybe get a better one??? Yeah, well no, wrong again. That amount is added into the rebate. So I am stuck deciding do I just take the $372 for a rebate exchange on a new Samsung, or take $272 for the purchase of a new non-Samsung brand. Absolutely ridiculous!!! Samsung customer service was horrible. No one spoke English, so I decided to use the chat on the computer instead. Yeah, it's all scripted and never answered any of my questions. So the only good part about it is since it was purchased at Lowes they have to pick up the old one, once we buy a new one. Then we're stuck coming up with the money for a new washer up front, filling out the mail in rebate, and mailing in our receipt to have our rebate back within 4-6 weeks I was told. I usually like the Samsung brand, but after this fiasco, I doubt I will ever buy another item made by that company. I will do my research first before going back to buy another one. Apparently after just now reading everyone else's reviews from the past year, I would have known what problems could arise and not buy one and waste my time, and my money.

This product works great!!! It cleans clothes like i never before seen. The spin cycle is so quiet and gets clothes almost completely dry which reduces the amount of drying time. I recommend this to anyone looking for a new washer.
Its pretty quite and large tub. Bought it during the Thanskgiving holiday and loving it.

I love, love my new washer. Its a top loader, deep bowl for holding lots of clothes or large blankets, rugs. Runs so quiet, push button settings, and it even plays music when its done washing so you know its done. A good price for this new HE washer. We definitely got our money's worth.

The washer pulsates which threw me off at first and then I caught a friend who has the same product and said that was normal she also had her product for several years and she's still checks on it to see if it's working or not that's how quiet it is I am in love with gadgets and this fits me. And the best thing is that it has bells and whistles literally.
This washer is great. The only drawback is that it seems to take a long time to complete its entire cycle. ( about 45 minutes. Is that normal?) I love the really large capacity.

review_titles: "This product has great features but weird water temps."
reviews: So far my only complaint is when "cold" water temp is used there is a hot and cold mix. Hot water alone sprays on clothes for a while not warm water. I don't like the hot water on my good clothes and I don't understand why the water uses hot at all for the cold temp.

I recently purchased this item and was so excited about the fact of not having an agitator as well as having the extra space. I was greatly surprised as to how bad this washer was. I put my husband's clothes in it and they smelled worse when we took them out than when we put them in. It does not appear to be washing anything. It makes a noise for about 10 secs then quiet. If it was really using 'wave' technology wouldn't it be making waves continuously to be cleaning the clothes? Makes no sense except to say that it just leaves my clothes in a vat of water to soak in filth then rinse what filth it can out. And spin like crazy to dry. Wish the 'wash' cycle worked as well as the spin cycle.

Really like how easy this washer is to use. It runs quietly and efficiently and always gets my clothes clean. It spins out nicely, so when I go to empty the washer they aren't sopping wet. I have had such a problem with previous washers. Overall really glad I bought it.
Washer is fast and quiet. Very nice and affordable.
I would defiantly recommend this and other products to all my friends
Love this washer, does not tangle clothes and the spin cycle is amazing how much it rings the clothes out! Completely satisfied!

I must I was very shocked to see the price that we paid for this name brand appliance. The name speaks for itself and the performance that I receive from this thing blows my mind. I would recommend this to a family and friend. I also have the matching dyer to go with it.

review_titles: "Samsung washer has the features I want."
reviews: I love my new Samsung washer. So many of the new washers today don't let you choose the water level and this one does. I like the soap dispenser. My clothes come clean every time.

Being a single guy in my 40's I never really gave much thought to my washer and dryer. If they ran and the clothes were clean then all was well. When my old washer finally gave out I decided to go ahead and invest in a brand new washer and dryer instead of a reconditioned set and I cannot believe what a difference it has made. I am a sucker for technology with lights and sounds, so I am a big fan of how this washer powers on. The big difference is in my clothes though. They smell so much cleaner and feel so much softer instead of dreading doing laundry I am washing everything in sight! It is quiet, does a great job, and is a pretty good value! Just another Samsung product I love and am glad I purchased. I would recommend it to anyone!
does great job.quiet running. uses less water then old machine.
This is a good washer. My clothes come out very clean. My only complaint is the washing time. The washing time is much longer than expected.

My washer was purchased in Aug of 2015. By March it had stopped working, entirely, and was down for 2 weeks before a repair person could come out. I didn't get any compensation for the time it was down, due to the wiring coming off. It was only 6 months old, so that should not have happened. Now they say the top can come off. defiantly not satisfied with this product.
super clean lines, great features, quiet, would recommend this to any body
This is the most basic model with very simple features that we could find for the price. We do not need all that electronic stuff, just a simple to operate machine that does the job.
Very fast and does it jobs real well. I like the warning sound and when wash finishes. All my clothes comes out nice and clean.
used washer twice and worked fine. still to early to give a full review

This washer was a great deal for the price and quality. I looked around multiple locations for a low price but good product. This washer is from a great company but a price low enough that you only pay a little more compared to a cheaper brand. Very satisfied with purchase.

I have not had it long but seem to be working fine no issues. The clothes come out clean,

This washer is amazing and is so easy to hook up and use , not even funny. The best part is when wash is done it sings a song to you , not bad at all . I would recommend , because it is reasonably priced and not heavy to move in.
Easy to use once you get use to it. Called Samsung and rcvd quick instructions. Large capacity, quick wash , not very loud. Two week owner.

review_titles: "Nice machine if it worked like it was supposed to."
reviews: Do not purchase this machine. It is very nice looking on the outside but with the issues from the spinning cycle / recall it will be a waste of money. Cannot use all the features that they show due to the recall issue. In my opinion it's like buying a 6 speed sports car and being told don't go into 6th gear because it doesn't work right. Very disappointed.

I love this new washer. It has a lot of features for the price. Can handle large loads, cleans well and it is relatively quiet. I think I got my money's worth.

Bought this washer after my last washer trans died. Didn't know if I wanted to spend this much, but glad I did. The washer is great. Does take a little while longer to wash, but clothes come out crisp n clean

Quality seems poor as it is plastic and top and door seem not very durable-- afraid of dings and scratches. Runs rather loud. Good capacity-- no agitator. Doesnt wash heavy soiled clothing well such as husbands work jeans. Like the alert when load is done.. melody played instead of usual loud alarm. I was so happy with the matching dryer that I decided to purchase this washing machine. The controls are smooth and easy to operate, I have arthritic hands. Load size is very good and the resulting wash performance is ideal for my needs . The product looks good, feels good and performs beyond my expectations. I am sure I will see a savings in my electric bill.

I have really enjoyed this washer! Very easy to use, the lid is very lightweight and has a safety mechanism so it won't fall and crush your fingers. Energy efficient and turns off once it's done to save electricity! Overall it's a great product for a great price and I would highly recommend to anyone!
Not as quiet as I thought but cleans clothes better than my old one

I bought this washer as a companion to the matching dryer. I like the features and the broad array of options with which to wash your clothes in a myriad of different cycles. When it senses that the load isn't balanced during a spin cycle, it will slow down so the clothes even out.  I would recommend this washer and dryer set to anyone looking to stay within a budget.

This washer was in a medium range on pricing, It was inexpensive and made great. The washer does a great job and holds a lot of clothes. It helps with washing the delicate material I have as well and leaves them feeling like new again and not torn up. I've used other brand washers in the past and feel very happy with my purchase. The sound it makes when it's running is different then what I'm used to but runs pretty quiet.
I purchased my washer because I have owned a front loader for almost 10 years, I have had many issues with it so I wanted a change!

review_titles: "Love my new Samsung washer, very quiet"
reviews: Only had a day, have done four loads, runs very quiet. So far I'm loving it!

This product, unlike previous washers I've had, is very powerful and has the additional advantage of an open and deep area, without the traditional center tubes that others had, and which permits bedspreads and large loads to amply wash. Great washer and sleek model.

I purchased this washer 12/12/2015. It works wonderfully. I have not had any problems at all. It's easy to use and runs very very quietly. We can't even hear it when the laundry room door is closed. No problems with the spin cycle. I like this washer better than my last two Whirlpools. I hope it holds up over time.

DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE!  This is not a washing machine.  It is a rinsing machine.  It does not use enough water to wash clothes and takes a long time and it uses too much water in the rinse cycle and does not rinse them long enough.  The machine does not allow you to tell it what to do . . . it does what it is pre-programed to do.  Of all the appliances we have ever purchased, this was the most expensive and it ABSOLUTELY the worst appliance we have ever had.  Do not expect Lowe's or Samsung to do anything about it.  When your check has cleared the bank, you are on your own.  Good luck getting clean clothes . . . will to happen with machine.  DO NOT BUY THIS RINSING MACHINE.

I've owned this machine for 3 years and I almost can't wait for the extended warranty to run off so I can replace it... After 3 years of use, here are my findings ..1. The machine rusts from the bottom up. If you look at the spot where the bleach goes in, somehow, without spilling bleach, the area rusts. It is a small space to pour bleach so you can never pour directly from the bottle otherwise you will spill it. We use a plastic measuring cup to prevent spilling...yet the machine rusts. 2. if you have one towel and a full load of clothes, the machine is out of balance and it will keep filling up with water and rinse until it gets tired at some point and starts beeping. You must wash like pieces of clothes ... for example, you can't put a sweatpants with a bunch of shirts. The sweat pants becomes too heavy and the machine is out of balance. 3. In order to really wash the clothes, you must put it on heavy duty wash otherwise the machine does not take in enough water to wash the clothes. Sometimes the machine will be running for 20 minutes and if you look in, the clothes in the middle are still not wet. All of that said, it is quite possible that all machines work this way and only because we can see through the glass on this one, we can complain about it...

We bought this machine 4.5 years ago.  We have had nothing but trouble with it. It went dead THE DAY AFTER the warranty ran out and we have had to have it repaired a number of times.  Finally decided to buy a different washer.  Will never buy another Samsung.  EVER!

This washer worked for about 6 months and needed to be repaired by Samsung 3 times in as many years. Now the washer started leaking. The washer rocked during the spin cycle so excessively that it usually did not complete its cycle. Samsung Customer Service claims the excessive rocking is caused by the laundry detergent which is impossible since I use the recommended type and amount of detergent. Samsung Customer Service has not responded to numerous calls and emails. I will never buy another Samsung washer again and would not recommend this produce to my worst enemy.

I haven't had many problems with this washer, but it does shake a fair amount.  This washer was recalled by Samsung.  Apparently, the whole top can become dislodged when washing bulky items. So now I've had my washer for 8 months and I already need to schedule a repair. They offer a rebate for those who want to buy a new washer instead, but the rebate is less than what I paid for the original and you have to wait 4-6 weeks to be reimbursed.
There is no review to accompany this rating.

I was worried about buying this particular model after reading the other reviews here, but since I figured I had a 4 out of 5 chance of loving this washer I thought I'd give it a whirl. I was not disappointed! It's a great washer. I've had it for about 3 weeks now and not a single problem. I've even washed my area rugs and blankets - no problems at all! I would definately recommend this washer, and especially Lowe's! Their staff was helpful and friendly and answered all my questions and even changed my delivery date without a hitch!Way to go Lowe's <3

I was happy about getting a new washer, until it started to give me trouble! The digital programming started to glitch after only 2 days. Upon turning it on the lights would just flash on and off and it would not let me select the size of load action, or the temp. The cute little song it played at the end of the load was not enough to make up for this. Also the lid locking in place is a nice safety feature, if you have kids. I don't. I hated that. I like it to be able to check the suds level and the water level to be sure its enough for the load I put in. I was not able to actually learn how much clothes matched the size of the load selected because I could never see it! Also, the plastic lid has a soft close feature and I liked that it would stay up at a half open position, but again, its plastic. Scratches would not doubt make the thing look *used* in short order. All in all I would say avoid this washer. Go with one that has more manual dials that wont be freaking out after only two days.

So disappointed in this washer (4.0 cu ft) by Samsung. The only thing good about this washing machine is the price. Other than that.....it's a no go. I just had this washing machine delivered on yesterday and its already making noises. First off, it sounds like a jet engine mixed with a lawn mower. During my very first wash, it was shaking and making knocking noises as if I had it for 10 years.  I will now have call for a service appointment after 1 day of use. Something doesn't sound or feel right with this scenario. Purchase at your own risk my friends.

I have seen so many terrible reviews on this washer and I don't understand why because if you read and follow the instructions it works like a dream! There is no agitator in this machine, there is a sensor instead. So you still need to load the machine as if there was an agitator (around the machine in a circle, keeping that sensor clear)and you will have no issues. My clothes come very clean and smell wonderful!

I didn't think this washer was so bad when we purchased it 10/2015. We did the best we could to level the floor to prevent the appliance from rocking, like most other users complain about. Nothing seemed to matter; the machine constantly rocked on any load, balanced or not. When the recall occurred, I started using the "delicate" setting, which has now been dubbed the "heavy bedding/waterproof" by Samsung. This helped a little, but not completely. I'm going to accept Samsung's rebate and buy a different washer from a different manufacturer. (Which sucks because they're only offering me half of what I paid for it.) I even hate the dryer that is supposed to accompany this unit. I've never been more unhappy with a washer and dryer, and that includes the rentals I've lived in!
